thread.title: Man charged with killing rare sea lion
thread.title_full: Man charged with killing rare sea lion

title: Man charged with killing rare sea lion
text:
Man charged with killing rare sea lion Last updated 15:27, February 28 2017 DOC 
Rua was a healthy 11-month-old pup. 
A man has been arrested after a sea lion was killed at Dunedin Harbour last year. 
Rua, an 11-month-old female sea lion was found shot dead at Portobello on November 5, 2016. 
The sea lion was found with a puncture wound to her side, consistent with a bullet hole, and a deep cut on the other side of her body. 
A 52-year-old man has been charged in relation to the killing, and will appear in Dunedin District Court on Friday, March 3. 
READ MORE: Sea Lion shot dead 
Police said the arrest was the result of a joint investigation between them, the Department of Conservation and the Dunedin Sea Lion Trust. 
Rua's body was sent to the Institute of Veterinary, Animal and Biomedical Sciences at Massey University for a necropsy to determine the cause of her death. 
"The brutal senseless shooting of a defenceless threatened native animal is a tragedy," said Annie Wallace, DOC Coastal Otago operations manager. 
Rua was one of only 11 sea lion pups born on the peninsula last summer, and "the impact of her death on the recovery of the New Zealand sea lion is not to be underestimated". 
"The few female sea lions around Dunedin are precious to the survival of the species," Wallace said. Ad Feedback 
"Rua was an otherwise completely healthy pup and we have every reason to believe she would have gone on to be a productive breeder." 
One of the world's rarest sea lions, New Zealand sea lions had a population of 10,000 and were classified as critically threatened, the same as kakapo and kiwi. 
Rua was last seen alive on Allans Beach on the peninsula in September 2016. 
Her birth at Warrington Beach last summer prompted the local community to name and care for her. - Stuff
